column2: the appetizers were tasty and contained some surprises
column3: though only one or two were genuinely memorable. The Veggie Mushi was an absolute flavor bomb of sweet
column5: and sour in the vein of a Thai Tom Kha soup. The Kinoko Usuzukari (thinly sliced mushrooms) is essentially an interesting vegetarian take on a delicate crudo; the vinegary and umami notes are delivered via fine sheets of spongy fungi topped with shallots. The copious charred and salty edamame were a nice filler course. The Brussel Sprouts with lemon and chili were decent
column6: but the original Uchi sprouts with caramelized fish sauce are leaps and bounds better. The Miso Soup was unremarkable.
